For the past few weeks, I've been working on a <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> for the [BDB Apollo/Saturn parts mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/122020-13-bluedog-design-bureau-saturn-apollo-development-v011-vaquero-6aug2016/). That <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> is all fairly squared away now, and in preliminary testing seems to work well with the 1.2 pre-release. If you haven't seen it, the BDB Apollo mod is one of the finest to come along in a while. Check it out!  I am proud to have been able to make a contribution to that effort.

One of the things I was able to accomplish in the course of building that <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> was to merge all the functionality and performance of the PEBKAC Mk1-2 <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> into a single part. The models are simplified and look cleaner and I've spent some time optimizing the textures so they aren't such ridiculous resource hogs. Most importantly, for the user, it makes life easier to drop one part in place, instead of three. With all that in mind I am going to make new versions of the PEBKAC <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> as single parts for the next release of this mod. The package will still include the original 3-part versions so existing builds should continue to work.

I'll try to get the next release out as soon as possible after 1.2 is officially released.

Cheers!

Well, I've had some trouble with the Mk1 <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr>, as I use <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> & <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> so instead of needing to hoist a mere 1224 kg away from the launch-stack, sometimes I need a <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> capable of getting 1707 kg of capsule, heat-shield, and parachute away from the launch-stack, and that's before counting the mass of the <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> itself. When the <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> tries to carry this much mass away from the stack, it manages to lift the capsule assembly a few dozen meters up but then starts doing cartwheels, which cause the rocket engines of the <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> to start thrusting back TOWARDS the launch-stack, and ultimately robbing the capsule of altitude it needs for the chute to have enough time to slow the capsule to a safe touchdown speed, resulting in a majority of aborts on the launch pad ending with the capsule crashing into the ground at >20 meters per second, killing the unlucky kerbonaut inside.

I included an example craft in the download that includes a heat-shield and parachute. No idea what it's mass is relative to just the pod itself or to the one you're flying. I'm not sure how <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> are impacting anything. Do you carry other stuff in the kerbals inventory that adds a lot of weight?

Anyway, most flight instability has to do with relationships between the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> and CoP of the escaping capsule. You might try adjusting the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> offset in the part config file to see if things settle down again.

You can load the example craft and look at where it's <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> is located. You want the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> of your escaping capsule to be in a similiar location.

Let me know how it goes. If you can post a craft file somewhere I will play with it if you want.

Your best option is to move the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> offset forward by a half-meter or so and see if it helps.

Add a line to pebkac\_mk1\_LES.cfg like:

    CoMOffset = 0.0, 0.5, 0.0

You will want to tweak that second value (0.5) until you get the stability you want. Increasing its value will move the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> forward, decreasing it will move it aft.

Good luck!

I've made a few minor tweaks to the plugin code to accommodate using it with other mod authors' <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> parts, specifically, the parts included with the [SDHI SMS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/48073-104-sum-dum-heavy-industries-service-module-system-v301-10-july-2015/) by [@sumghai](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/66272-sumghai/). I have a design goal of making it generic enough to use with any <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> parts anybody else creates as well. If you fall into this category, let me know and I'll try to help you if you hit a snag.

To use this beta plugin, you will also need to make some minor changes to the config files for the <abbr title="Launch Escape System">LES</abbr> rocket and BPC parts. How to do that is explained in the readme file in the download.

[You can download the beta release from dropbox](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/95986775/PK_LES_1.2.0.2.zip).

Eventually I will make an official release. Mainly I want to give @sumghai  or anybody else a chance to verify it's working well with the SDHI parts before I do that.
